converted adjective
(CHANGED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ before noun ] having changed in form or character, or been made suitable for a different use: Their homes are converted shipping containers.
More examplesFewer examplesThe restaurant is a converted warehouse with long wooden tables.You can stay in a converted monastery.He rides a converted road bike.

converted adjective
(NEW BELIEF)
having changed to a new religion, belief, or opinion: He's a converted Muslim. I was sceptical about the changes but a year later, I'm completely converted. the converted
people who have changed their religion, belief, or opinion: I use this product, not because I'm paid to, but because I'm simply one of the converted. See also
preach to the converted
More examplesFewer examplesThe converted Jews and Moors who remained in Spain were viewed with suspicion by the Inquisition.The rebellion over welfare reform suggests that many party members are far from converted.

(SPORTS)
